line_1: Well, they both took a dram, and return'd to the battle,
line_2: And with a fresh fury they made the swords rattle;

line_1: Yon' bloody Rogues intend a Battel.
line_2: I'd tell it You, but for the Rattle

line_1: Did, sure as Trumpet, call to Battel;
line_2: Our Don, who knew this Tittle Tattle

line_1: The sophist's paltry arts of battle;
line_2: He knew the little sceptic prattle,

line_1: Some, when th' affair was Blenheim's glorious battle,
Who ever stood so tough a battle?
line_2: About his ears how strange a rattle!

line_1: Who ever stood so tough a battle?
line_2: H' has tam'd the most unruly cattle. —
